snippet: A judge said Edward J. Marquette’s case fell into a difficult category for sentencing, one in which people who have led good lives do something very wrong.
abstract: Judge Thomas Farber sentences former New York City crane inspector Edward J Marquette to five years probation; Marquette was accused of fabricating an inspection report of a towering crane, which later collapsed and killed seven people.
lead_paragraph: A judge said Edward J. Marquette’s case fell into a difficult category for sentencing, one in which people who have led good lives do something very wrong.

headline.seo: Inspector in Fatal Crane Collapse Gets Probation
headline.main: Inspector in 2008 Crane Collapse Gets Probation
headline.print_headline: Inspector in 2008 Crane Fall Gets Probation
